event.summary: 12/10/1993: Members of Kach killed three Palestinian men who were sitting in a parked car, claiming they carried out the murder to avenge the shooting deaths earlier that week of two Jews. Reports stated that the Palestinian men were returning home from work in Israel in a station wagon when the perpetrators, in a car with Israeli license plates, opened fire on the vehicle.
event.motive: To avenge the shooting deaths of two Jews earlier that week
event.addnotes: Israel Radio said a caller announced that the attack was to avenge Monday's killing of the father and son. Television reports said the militant, ultranationalist Kach movement took responsibility for the triple murder.
event.scite1: David Hoffman, “3 Palestinians Killed in West Bank; Rising Violence Linked to Efforts To Block Pullout,” The Washington Post, December 11, 1993.
event.scite2: “Police Minister: No Signs Of New Jewish Terror Group,” The Associated Press, December 11, 1993.
event.scite3: Bill Hutman, “Police have lead on killers of three Palestinians, says Shahal. Car involved in attack found near Beit Shemesh,” The Jerusalem Post, December 12, 1993.
